nodes.text: Any type of facilitation payment is prohibited, large or small. Even where such payments are perceived as a common practice and even if our competitors engage in such practices, no violations of this principle will be tolerated.
Continue to resist any demand for this kind of payment. Say no and use the examples to help you.

There is a risk that you are being asked to make an unauthorised payment.  Paying a small sum of money to an official as a fine can be a facilitation payment in disguise. No matter how small the amount, facilitation payments are illegal in most countries in which we operate and UK law forbids them anywhere in the world.  Even if not instigated by you, paying facilitation payments can seriously damage our reputation.

You should strongly resist any demand for this kind of payment. Remain calm and be prepared to wait.  Showing impatience can increase pressure to pay.  Say no and use the following to help you challenge the fee.
Remain courteous, respectful and if possible friendly
Ask to speak to the supervisor/manager of the person making the demand to discuss why you cant pay
State that you would need an official receipt if you were to pay the fine and guage the response.
Make it clear that your company does not allow you to make irregular, non-standard or unofficial payments of any kind
Ask for name and official title of person asking and any identity number
Mention that you will contact the embassy / consulate to discuss / report the issue
Explain that you must call your company first to report the issue and to get permission to pay the fee
Take notes or make mental note of the conversations and the time and place for a later report
Do you feel threatened in any way or are you being coerced into paying?
Gifts should only be accepted as a one off and not one of many from the same person / company.  The exception would be company branded promotional items.
If you have been offered or have received non promotional gifts such as chocolate or similar from this person or company before, talk to your manager before accepting.

The danger of accepting multiple gifts from business contacts is that, unfairly or not, colleagues and others including other business partners, may question your impartiality and professional integrity.  The more frequently you accept gifts the more chance this may happen.

Although you may believe that the chocolate is offered with no ulterior motive, multiple gifts even of low value, could be misinterpreted by others who could perceive acceptance as making you or your decisions biased, conflicted or obligated.  It maybe safer to decline on this occasion than to take the risk.

As the gift is not a promotional item do not be embarrassed to decline it and be clear that you are by doing so in writing.  Simply explain that you are not in a position to accept them using the rules and the reasons given here as explanation.
If you feel it is appropriate to accept the chocolate, report them to your line manager.
Always acknowledge the acceptance of a gift in writing to the sender.
